column1: '''''End of the World''''' is the title of an illustration by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]].<ref name=AI>{{HM

''End of the World'' shows an apparently carefree man stepping out from a cliff into an abyss. Beyond the cliff are the [[Sun]], the [[Moon]], and [[stars]] — elements which are pivotal in Tolkien's [[legendarium]]. The illustration was made in December [[1912]], and was collected by Tolkien with other illustrations from the same period in an envelope labelled "[[The Book of Ishness
While explicitly claiming no direct link between the two illustrations, [[Dimitra Fimi]] has noted the resemblance of Tolkien's ''End of the World'' to [[Wikipedia:The Fool (Tarot card)
column2: The Fool]] from the [[Wikipedia:Rider-Waite tarot deck
